episodes.synopsis: In the 1980s, technology innovators Steve Jobs and Bill Gates build companies that revolutionize personal computers and bring them into every home.
episodes.title: Jobs vs. Gates

episodes.synopsis: A bitter rivalry forms between Glenn Curtiss and Orville and Wilbur Wright as they develop powered flight and seek to control the aviation market.
episodes.title: Wright Brothers vs. Curtiss

episodes.synopsis: Inventor Philo Farnsworth dreams up the idea for television, but chaos ensues when businessman David Sarnoff, founder of RCA, goes after his patent.
episodes.title: Farnsworth vs. Sarnoff

episodes.synopsis: William Randolph Hearst and Joseph Pulitzer build newspaper empires, but the tycoons face both competition from each other and strikes from workers.
episodes.title: Hearst vs. Pulitzer

episodes.synopsis: In the 1800s, the competition to perfect the revolver goes ballistic as Samuel Colt and Daniel Wesson seek to refine their highly profitable weapons.
episodes.title: Colt vs. Wesson

episodes.synopsis: At the height of the Cold War, America and the Soviet Union race to see which will reach space first, with each side creating trailblazing technology.
episodes.title: Space Race

episodes.synopsis: Brilliant minds collide as Nikola Tesla and Thomas Edison wage a furious campaign to ensure that their own version of electricity powers the world.
episodes.title: Edison vs. Tesla

episodes.synopsis: World War II spawns a battle to achieve nuclear mastery as J. Robert Oppenheimer and Werner Heisenberg lead teams racing to build an atomic bomb.
episodes.title: Oppenheimer vs. Heisenberg

video.title: American Genius
video.synopsis: This series depicts some of America's fiercest scientific and technological rivalries, including Colt vs. Wesson, Edison vs. Tesla and Jobs vs. Gates.
